website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice if you want premium quality in a bracket design.
pros: Made of natural rubber in a galvanized steel frame
cons: They can be noisy, especially in wintry conditions

customer_reviews.title: RAINX BLADE ON ONE SIDE BOSH ICON ON OTHER comparison
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blade and put it on the drivers side. I then put a Bosch icon on the right. As always I wanted the best. I read many articles claiming the Bosch and Raines were both good, so I purchased both. The rain x had 3 unique characteristics. It always performed worse and streaked. The Bosch icon did not. The rain x assembly rusted. The Bosch icon did not. The rain x fell apart. This was only after 1 year and maybe 5000 miles of driving over a winter in Ohio. I won’t be buying this brand of wiper again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Rob your piggy bank and buy a better blade than these
customer_reviews.text: Before these Rain X, I had splurged and bought Bosch Icon wipers which were fantastic and lasted 3 years. Time finally came when I needed to replace them, and felt like I should economize and bought Rain X. At first they were okay, but squeaked and didn’t clear the windscreen as well as the Bosch. Okay, I didn’t expect them to perform as well for the price, but after just a few months...oh boy! Such a disappointment! These blades did not hold up. They streaked and left a film that made it hard to see in certain light. I won’t be buying these again. I’ll spend double the money and get four times the value and life!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: They're budget wipers and didn't work well for me after only 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: They work as long as the windshield is good and wet. If it's just misty out these will skip across the windshield. I know old wipers will do that eventually as the rubber hardens but these are only two months old and skip across the windshield. My old wipers cost more than twice as much and lasted much longer +2 years before they started skipping. I just didn't want to spend another $50 for a set of windshield wipers. Like razor blades for shaving, the mark-up on wipers are ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: SyfiMan

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed, doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to last very long. Holds up poorly in bad weather, and if you accidently hit the wiper button with a dry windshield, the rubber will tear off very quickly. This item broke when I used it to clear the moisture from an overnight fog. The metal / plastic clip that attaches to the wiper handle of my car broke off even though there was plenty of water on the windshield. Before it broke, it was unsatisfactory during normal use. In light rain, there were streaks of water instead of a clean wipe.
customer_reviews.author: pablo

customer_reviews.title: Junk...
customer_reviews.text: These weren't very good the day I put them on. And they quickly deteriorated from there. They were so bad that I decided to go in to the Honda dealer and buy OEM blades. Those were ridiculously expensive, so I asked the Honda parts guy what he used on his cars. He said he used Bosch Icon blades. So I bought those and never looked back. I'll never buy Rain-X products again.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Only Rain X!
customer_reviews.text: I drive a Mini Cooper and had gotten good wipers from Costco because they are at Costco and everything is good there but they just didn’t seem to fit right. I love the Rain X ones I purchased here and will only stick with these now because they are slim and do a great job without streaking and breaking down.
customer_reviews.author: AlysonTCTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: These are so good, I bought them again! My initial windshield wipers from Rain-X have lasted over 8 months (over the summer where there's desert heat) and are still working very well. Because of how well they've dealt with the heat we get where I live and how well they work against the rain, I went ahead and got another pair a few days ago for my wife's car as well. Fits great, easy installation (don't really even need the instructions), and I would definitely recommend these to anyone who's looking for a great deal and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Schnurr

customer_reviews.title: please don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a month ago for my husband's car and it snapped in half. Now we have to buy a replacement and potentially fix/replace his windshield because it has a huge gouge in it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddison

customer_reviews.title: Simple install once you determined which clip was required!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Ram 2500. I read the instructions (yeah, I know—but these are wipers!!) and realized I’d have to remove the installed smaller inner clip and use the larger clip provided. Snap out, snap in. Slide blade over the wiper and push until you hear the plastic snap into place. Easy install once you figured out what needed to be done. Wish these manufacturers would decide on a single lock system, so we wouldn’t spend so much time trying to figure out the endless varieties of blades and attachments. Give this set an “A” plus for simplicity!
customer_reviews.author: Schrocker

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect this
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 26" and this 18" which fits my 2016 Civic and both wipers do leave a streak. Frustrating that brand new wipers can't do its job and wipe the windshield clean. I feel like these were used but they came in unopened original Rain-X package. Not sure if I should return them and keep searching or just deal with the annoyance of it. They seem very light as well but they were fine on the highway in rain. Video shows the 18" not able to wipe part of windshield and you can see the streaking on the 26" as well.. Probably due to being so light weight.
customer_reviews.author: RLF

customer_reviews.title: I'll pass next time
customer_reviews.text: They work great for 6 months, then they started streaking. The little plastic cap that is supposed to keep them in place is pretty poor and pops off if you lift the wipers to wash your car or any other reason. I regularly lift and clean my wipers with alcohol, then treat them with a heavy dose of protector. I generally am able to keep a set of wipers for well over a year before having to replace them this way. Not so with these, I will not buy RainX again. Next time I will spring for the silicone rubber ones and with proper maintenance, be done with it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H

customer_reviews.title: Easiest wipers ever
customer_reviews.text: These are the easiest and most affordable wipers ever. Standard J hook slides right in with no issues at all. There are a ton of different sizes to accommodate different vehicles. I ordered a 20 inch and an 18 inch no problem at all. The best part about these wipers is that they actually work really really well! They perform better than the brand new wipers that came on my car when I got it brand new. If I ever need more wipers, these are my go to
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M.

customer_reviews.title: Clean Sweep
customer_reviews.text: The blades wipe a nice clean sweep... But, the drops keep coming back... I know, ...that was supposed to be humor... My van has a "J-Hook" arrangement to attach the blades which was a little confusing to me... I had to keep the old blade near for reference... The new blades have an adapter gizmo that works with all types of installation... Everyone should keep their blades new, vision is nice to have in the rain... These do a good job...
customer_reviews.author: KFinFL

customer_reviews.title: Rain-X vs Anco - one rules, the other drools
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Rain-X, but decided to be "cheap" last year and get ANCO brand wipers. Bad idea! They were completely obliterated by our Chicago winter which wasn't even as harsh as previous years. Not only that, but I remember having quite a bit of trouble installing those onto the J-hook style arms. Not so with these Rain-X wipers! Not only was the installation super easy (push in, click, done), but I know they can last quite a long while before needing to be replaced. FYI - these were purchased for a 2004 Chevy Tahoe (22-inch).
customer_reviews.author: J. C. G.

customer_reviews.title: I like these in theory
customer_reviews.text: I like these in theory. I bought a 24" and an 18"... 3 months later, the connector between the 18" and the wiper arm broke. The 24" is still just fine. I'm re-ordering an 18" and hope it was just a defect, or something hit it, or something.......... But I see several reviews about this part breaking so it may be a poor product in general. I hope not because I do like how effectively they clear water.
customer_reviews.author: J. Farrar

customer_reviews.title: good ! might need help if you’re not a car person
customer_reviews.text: I am not a car person but my boyfriend told me to get these, were easy for him to get onto my car but I was having issues haha. So maybe have someone help you who knows what they’re doing. Also didn’t realize it’s only one not the set so if you’re new to cars like me make sure to buy the two hahah. Other than that it works just great for winter I’m in Utah snow and it works great/
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: I really like that I can order things like this from Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like that I can order things like this from Amazon -- the convenience canʻt be beat, particularly since this blade size is very popular in my town and itʻs often sold out when I go to the store. Beyond that, everything was as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ipo Kahele

customer_reviews.title: Not for snowy/ sub freezing conditions.
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these wipers for snow conditions. Both of my brand new wiper blades came off in terrible, near white out conditions. The supplied plastic brackets would not hold, or cracked and broke to due cold. The wipers were not even pushing a snow load. It put me in a dangerous situation at 7740ft elevation to have no wipers in severe snow, and have to exit the vehicle to remedy the situation. Done with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: d petri

customer_reviews.title: 16" works, 26" does not
customer_reviews.text: The passenger side wiper fits fine. The driver's side does not: the factory wiper clamp is offset, and sits next to the low-profile arm. This Rain-X wiper is not offset and sits below the low profile arm. The arm hits Rain-X wiper and doesn’t allow even pressure on the blade. This causes the last several inches of the blade to have no pressure, to the point that the blade is in the air, not even touching the glass. I would return the 26" if it didn't come as a pair. Recommend for emergencies/short term but otherwise I will stick with factory wipers in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Fresh New Blades
customer_reviews.text: It's items like this that make me love Amazon. They sell these blades up the road at the auto part store for almost twice the price. Don't make the mistake of buying blades that have been sitting out on the shelves dry rotting at your local auto-part store, like I did less than a year ago. Get fresh new blades like these and have them delivered to your door! They arrived in 2 days and they were so easy to install. They fit my cars perfectly and I'm loving my new blades! It's so nice to be able to see well when driving in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Nxactly

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 6 uses
customer_reviews.text: I thought Rain-X was a good brand. I just had to replace these 2 weeks ago after using them not working for a few weeks. So they actually were shot by November. I bought them in June. It's been a drought this year and rained MAYBE 6 times. So these have been hardly used. And still, they were crap after 6 months. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Bondora

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install with alternate connector
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the longer wiper for my car, this wiper was very hard to install and the instructions were not very helpful for my car. I had to remove the pre-installed connector and put in the other provided connector. The directions essentially said remove the pre-installed one and connect the new one in the middle. The pre-installed one was hard to remove, even with tools, and the new one did not provide enough space for the hook to go in all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Tae J Im

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... I've had these on for about a month (ordered 2 of the same blade just different sizes to suit my needs) I have used these through some pretty heavy Hawaiian storms and they have kept my visibility as clear as it could ge in those situations. Overall very satisfied. (For reference I used this on a 2004 Honda crv)
customer_reviews.author: Chele

customer_reviews.title: SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK
customer_reviews.text: SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK. Do I need to say more? Noisiest wiper blades I've ever owned - so annoying. They were bad to begin with, but horrible in cold weather. They squeak and bounce across the windshield. Good thing these are cheap because they're going in the trash. Would not use these even if they were free.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last more than a Month
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my wife's car. A month later, they were chattering on the windshield and leaving black marks. The wife said she would use them when it was raining very heavy out, then she would have to stop to put them back on. These were installed on a Ford that uses the J-hooks. The OEM blades stay on with no issue, but these just will not stay in place. They did great, were tight, and wiped well for the first few weeks. After a month of solid use in the rain here in Florida, they were worse than the OEM ones that were almost 2 years old. I won't buy these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy76

customer_reviews.title: felt apart
customer_reviews.text: I think it was the second use of the blades because of the rain in the middle of the highway, the driver's side blade was felt apart about 9 pm. I had to stop on the emergency side road. It could have caused an accident. I had to drive the rest of the road without the driver's side blade. It seems that I missed the return period.
customer_reviews.author: amisos

customer_reviews.title: they clean but squeak and SQUEAK .... poor design, extreme squeaking
customer_reviews.text: horrible, horrible wiper blades. on the plus side: they clean pretty well, on the other side: they squeak like there is no tomorrow. Through the sound-shield OEM front windshield of my 2015 F150 the squeaking is so loud that it's distracting and you cringe every time that wiper blade goes over the windshield. The wiper blade is poorly designed and must put stupid pressure on the rubber = squeak squeak squeak. Returning back to amazon and buying Bosch Icon blades instead.
customer_reviews.author: CJaeck

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Decent Wipers
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arizona and we don't get a whole lot of rain. The Arizona summers KILL windshield wipers. I normally change them around fall time as winters can be cold and water/ice on the windshield in the mornings. They'll last through the winter and into spring/summer.. If we have Monsoons.. heavy rain every night in the summer.. the wipers will need to be replaced after that.. But once a year here in AZ - we're good! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great wiper blades!
customer_reviews.text: So far, these are doing a good job. Glass is clean and streak free. I actually had a friend install them because I suck with wiper blades, but they seem to go on easily. I've only had them on for a month or so -- I'll update my review if anything changes. I typically change my blades about once a year, but I don't drive a lot and Colorado doesn't get a lot of rain, so others may have to change them more often. But I've always had good luck with this brand, so I have high hopes that they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kym

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: This is not a criticism of the product, but more of Amazon's matching with your car. I have an 2002 Audi A4 and this is not even close to fitting. I got a refund, but seemed like a loss of resources in packaging and shipping. So make sure you check outside of Amazon that the part fits your car.
customer_reviews.author: zman

customer_reviews.title: Needs Curve for CRV
customer_reviews.text: Have a Honda CRV. It has a long curved windshield that takes this size, but they don't fit the curve of the windshield, so it doesn't really work in the middle. Since then, I've noticed that there are curved or arched ones. If you have a CRV, you need one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Best Hubris

customer_reviews.title: Subscribe and Save Saves Me!
customer_reviews.text: The entire reason I love these: Subscribe and Save. I am absolutely horrible about replacing my windshield wipers. I have noticed they were torn, meant to pick up more, and then driven for a week with rain before doing anything about it. So with Subscribe and Save, I'm set up to replace them every 6 months whether I think I need it or not. And if they are working and I don't get around to changing them right away, at least I have them and won't forget to stop and get more.
customer_reviews.author: P J

customer_reviews.title: Subscribe and Save for the Win!
customer_reviews.text: The entire reason I love these: Subscribe and Save. I am absolutely horrible about replacing my windshield wipers. I have noticed they were torn, meant to pick up more, and then driven for a week with rain before doing anything about it. So with Subscribe and Save, I'm set up to replace them every 6 months whether I think I need it or not. And if they are working and I don't get around to changing them right away, at least I have them and won't forget to stop and get more.
customer_reviews.author: P J

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well on my 2006 Toyota Corolla LE
customer_reviews.text: Installed this and another Rain-X Wiper Blade to my 2006 Toyota Corolla LE several weeks ago. So far, they both work very well, and were very easy to attach to the car. The convenience of purchasing wiper blades online is much more worth the money than purchasing in store - just gotta make sure you get the right sizes. Overall, these blades appear to work great, and I would not hesitate to purchase another set from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marble

customer_reviews.title: Works great on a 2006 Toyota Corolla LE
customer_reviews.text: Installed this and another Rain-X Wiper Blade to my 2006 Toyota Corolla LE several weeks ago. So far, they both work very well, and were very easy to attach to the car. The convenience of purchasing wiper blades online is much more worth the money than purchasing in store - just gotta make sure you get the right sizes. Overall, these blades appear to work great, and I would not hesitate to purchase another set from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marble

customer_reviews.title: Third blade used, one failed in 10 months
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this blade three separate times for two different cars. The 19-inch right side blade broke. The clip holding the blade to the wiper itself broke so now the wiper will not stay attached to the car. That's pretty weak considering I purchased this back in November 2018 and it is now August 2019. Sigh. I would have preferred it lasting at least 12 months or have the warranty support a one-time replacement. I think the actual warranty is 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Han Yee Lui

customer_reviews.title: It leaves a terrible unwiped streak when on
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT FIT 2010 HONDA CRV. I'm not saying anyone is a liar but it's being misreported as compatible on Amazon and Rain-X's website. The problem is that no matter how you attempt to apply it, 1/3 of the blade does not sit flush on the glass and cannot be made to sit flush on the glass. It leaves a terrible unwiped streak when on. Fortunately I had not thrown away my old wiper blade. I've used Rain-X weatherbeater blades before on a 2008 Mazda 3 and had liked them. This review is 1-Star due to fit, not quality.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I've only had issues with one or two other brands but these seem to be the best deal for the price that I have found
customer_reviews.text: I've tried just about every brand of windshield wipers and always seem to come back to these. I've only had issues with one or two other brands but these seem to be the best deal for the price that I have found. The do a great job of cleaning my windshield and seem to last longer than most. Always happy with Rain-X blades.
customer_reviews.author: Brad J

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but a couple of minor issues
customer_reviews.text: This wiper works well, but I've noticed a couple of minor issues. The first is that if I need to use them for an extended time they seem to get a little loud. The other is that the wiper has started leaving a nearly-vertical linear smudge on the windshield when it completes its upward sweep and begins to go back down. The smudge dries off quickly, but it's a tiny bit distracting as it's right in my line of sight. I'll use these wipers until they need to be replaced, but I'll probably look for another brand at that time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Myska

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am usually freaked out by trying to replace windshield wipers because it always seems to somehow be a huge hassle. Although I was a little hesitant to do it myself, I was successfully able to put these on with ease. As for the blades themselves I am very happy with my purchase as they seem to work much better than other brands. And for the price on prime day you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Cee

customer_reviews.title: Fit 2016 JGC High Altitude
customer_reviews.text: They fit my 2016 JGC High Altitude perfectly. A bit disappointed in their durability though. I live in TX, where we get no snow or really much cold weather... or much rain to be honest. As a result, these really do not get used or abused all that much. After ~5 months of use, these are streaking really bad look like they went through a pretty harsh winter up North. Meh - not too thrilled with these and will probably explore a different option in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: They Just Don't Last More than a Month
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my wife's car. A month later, they were chattering on the windshield and leaving black marks. The wife said she would use them when it was raining very heavy out, then she would have to stop to put them back on. These were installed on a Ford that uses the J-hooks. The OEM blades stay on with no issue, but these just will not stay in place. They did great, were tight, and wiped well for the first few weeks. After a month of solid use in the rain here in Florida, they were worse than the OEM ones that were almost 2 years old. I won't buy these ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy76

customer_reviews.title: The wiper is fine, but...
customer_reviews.text: These blades work well, install easily and seem to work smoothly. But check out the ridiculous packaging used. Ordered at exactly the same time. It looks like doll furniture in a person's house. Once again, what a waste of resources. I suspect it may be because the packers in their warehouses have to work so fast they don't have time to think about it. Typical for Amazon, I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: S. O. Rooney MA GGCP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install yourself
customer_reviews.text: Simple to remove old and install new. Much cheaper then the cost at the auto part store and since you have to have it might as well save as much $ as possible. I live in FL so wiper blades do not last that long in this sun, especially through the summers so longevity is just OK but with these downpours we get you better have some decent wipers. These work great.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Stephens

customer_reviews.title: can not instal on my car.
customer_reviews.text: looks decint enoguh but the multi blade adapter did not fit my vehicle. I order 3 of these for my car and I installed the first two just fine but there multi blade adapter on this blade did not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bode

customer_reviews.title: Buy cheap pay twice.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap material on the driver side the rubber portion that slide on the windshield is hard that it almost not wipe water the one on the passenger side bent on a rainy day scratch the windshield now I have to spend a lot of money on a new windshield and on new wipers. Would not recommend spend more money buy good quality rainx not making quality product anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Replaced after 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: I gave an extra star because I did at least get 3 months out of these wipers. However I would not reccomend them. They lose their ability to clear rain really quick. I didn’t even use them in the winter. I put them on in June and needed new ones by Sept. For a few extra bucks you can get much better quality blades out there that actually last... Stay away for these cheap POS....
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wiper blade for my 2013 Hyundai elantra and they work just as expected, they leave a clean and strike free glass after using it. I been using them for about 5 month and they still working as new. The instalation process is pretty straight forward, even thought they provide cristal clear instructions on how to install them. I have seem many people complaining about the fitment but that is amazon faults if they told you the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: Lenin R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Replacement, perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: The Rain X brand work great and keep on working a little longer than other brands. Wisconsin is tough on wipers and they last almost a year. I've bought these before and I'll buy these again. I've installed these on a dozen different cars the last few years and they always fit right, click into place, and stay put. Buy these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toll

customer_reviews.title: Best install!
customer_reviews.text: Omg these were a breeze to install. Took me less than 30 seconds. In the past I bought wiper blades and they would take forever to get the clips assembled & on correctly. These literally slide right on through the arm hold on the metal pieces. Definitely would recommend these over any other brand for this type of product.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Basic, but works and is affordable...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about these other than the RainX name... they are working fine and will need replacement every year just like other brands since they use "Natural rubber" One of the lower priced brand name wipers so made the purchase of 26" and 18" for 2016 Jeep Cherokee. So far so good RainX says; Meets or exceeds all original equipment manufacturers’ standards
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Performs better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace wipers on my Ford F150 - 2003... These were VERY easy to swap out - I am impressed with how well the Rain-X wiper works... I may become a Rain-X fan going forward for all of my vehicles...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: There are cheaper wipers on the market, BUT they don't compare to these, we just had a bad rain storm and I was driving in it, I had these wiper going and the made a huge difference, It wiped the rain away and didn't leave any streaks behind! I will change out all of my vehicles wipers to Rain-X Wipers
customer_reviews.author: Richie L

customer_reviews.title: Factory packaging had been opened.
customer_reviews.text: The wiper package was open because the seal was broken. It looked ok so I put it on the car. The top end of the blade did not even touch the windshield just like someone else described and attached a picture. Perhaps this is a "second" or factory reject. It didn't appear bent though. Wont buy a wiper online again! p.s. I made it work by removing the rubber and putting it in the old one, like you would with a refill.
customer_reviews.author: Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: G
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wiper (in a bunch of different orders for all the sizes I needed) 2 years ago, and again recently. They held up well, they wipe well, are reasonably priced. So I bought them again for my 3 vehicles. I'll look but I will probably have to repeat this review since I got them in several orders to cover the sizes I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Good "traditional" style wipers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wiper (in a bunch of different orders for all the sizes I needed) 2 years ago, and again recently. They held up well, they wipe well, are reasonably priced. So I bought them again for my 3 vehicles. I'll look but I will probably have to repeat this review since I got them in several orders to cover the sizes I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS! Defective!?!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE! DANGEROUS! I recently purchased these wiper blades. They have not been on my car more than a month. At night while raining, one wiper blade snapped and went perpendicular to the arm holding it. Unable to stop where I was, I kept trying to find the the correct setting to turn the wipers off. The other wiper kept moving slightly. Hopefully this has not damaged my car. When I was able to find a lit safe place to put over, I found that the piece of the wiper that holds it in place completely broke off. Maybe mine was defective. I will never purchase this item again! Cancelling my autoship.
customer_reviews.author: Keri M.

customer_reviews.title: Specifications said that it fits it does not
customer_reviews.text: If you are sent one that fits you are vehicle congratulations the specification said that if it's my vehicle and I did not. I had to go to an unnamed store that I cannot say the name of because the people at Google will not allow that. But it only took 3 seconds compared to the 30 minutes I tried forcing the windshield wiper I was sent by this seller
customer_reviews.author: Jordon

customer_reviews.title: Sent with parts missing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the right front of my 2006 Saturn Vue. I just ordered a second one, because the first one came missing a piece that was supposed to lock the wiper blade to the wiper arm. I didn’t realize there was a missing piece until I turned on the wipers in a storm. I installed it hoping it would stay in place, but it keeps coming loose when they’re on, and flopping around all over my windshield. I was afraid it would scratch the glass, so I had to drive not using the wipers while it was raining. Frustrating! Hopefully the new one will come with all the necessary parts....
customer_reviews.author: GREG

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipers
customer_reviews.text: These are the best windshield wipers I've ever used. I've always used rain-x wipers on my cars because it helps to keep the rain at bay and I can see much clearer. It makes me feel safer when driving in the rain. Won't use any other wipers. These also last years so I won't have to replace my wipers for at least a couple of years or so. Can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipers
customer_reviews.text: These are the best windshield wipers I've ever used. I've always used rain-x wipers on my cars because it helps to keep the rain at bay and I can see much clearer. It makes me feel safer when driving in the rain. Won't use any other wipers. These also last years so I won't have to replace my wipers for at least a couple of years or so. Can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Saved time and money going from one auto part store to another. Removing the old pair might be a little tricky. Just search the instruction online and you'll see the trick to undo the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Morimo

customer_reviews.title: Working in CO winter
customer_reviews.text: So far they are lasting well. And keeping my window clear in the Colorado winter weather. Only had them a couple of weeks. Will update as the year goes on. Hopefully they will last over a year, as other brands I have gotten only seem to last that long.
customer_reviews.author: Superbeckee

customer_reviews.title: May have gotten a bad batch :(
customer_reviews.text: Honestly kind of upset with these. I always buy this brand but i bought these when I got my r53 and they will not stop squeaking. I thought it was just because they were new but two months later, I’ve cleaned the windshield and the wipers and applied tons of things to both trying to remedy this issue and they just keep screeching as they go across the windshield, torrential downpour or drizzle.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: May have gotten a bad batch :(
customer_reviews.text: Honestly kind of upset with these. I always buy this brand but i bought these when I got my r53 and they will not stop squeaking. I thought it was just because they were new but two months later, I’ve cleaned the windshield and the wipers and applied tons of things to both trying to remedy this issue and they just keep screeching as they go across the windshield, torrential downpour or drizzle.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Significant downgrade from Premium grades
customer_reviews.text: I can live with this product as my car lease term is ending in some months. If you are, however, planning to keep your car for next years, I think it is better to go "Premium". This product is good, very easy to install, can do the job that you expect, but it looks so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Takashi Namba

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2006 Scion xB
customer_reviews.text: Installed immediately onto 2006 Scion xB and did not require the included adapter. Took more time to remove the old wiper arm than install the new one. This unit just slides into the J-hook and click-locks into place. Install your wiper blades in pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on wipin!
customer_reviews.text: this bad boy can wipe a windshield like you've never seen before. its as if the world has become brighter and people seem happier when you look through it. As i drive people look into my window and i can see they are thinking what im thinking, your teeth are so damn white. what a smile big fella! bravo!!
customer_reviews.author: Shim

customer_reviews.title: Works just Okay when it comes to heavy winter weather
customer_reviews.text: I’d have to say they work pretty well but not the best wiper I’ve had. Works great for rain but is mediocre when it comes to heavier winter weather. Living in Buffalo we have some crazy winter weather so if you don’t have to deal with that kind of weather these will work good for you.
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: works well for my car
customer_reviews.text: works well for me. on my car, it don't pay to get junk for wiper blades those may not fit. these Rain X blades fit well, and have, always worn well. I don't need, super high priced blades, but need good quality these rain x blades fit the bill to a T. I would recomend these.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Gilbert III

customer_reviews.title: Clear vision
customer_reviews.text: Another good Rainex product. Super clear and can see much better. Can’t rate the longevity yet but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Both wipers came without the adapters to fit my vehicle, nor the insert with instructions. Due to our lockdown situation I cannot return them...
customer_reviews.author: Sean M

customer_reviews.title: They're black
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Miata to replace the beam style blades that have lived a long a long and fruitful life. These wipers have lived through a few dewy mornings and rainstorms and seem to work just like new wipers should. They're not going to be great in the dead of winter, but they're great summer/warm climate wipibois
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Empty box
customer_reviews.text: 2 wiper blades shipped in two boxes, one box look like it had been tampered with but didn’t check immediately as people showed up so 3 hours later found 19 inch wiper blade not in box. Once I picked it up again very simple to tell it had been opened up.
customer_reviews.author: Dutchman

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am usually freaked out by trying to replace windshield wipers because it always seems to somehow be a huge hassle. Although I was a little hesitant to do it myself, I was successfully able to put these on with ease. As for the blades themselves I am very happy with my purchase as they seem to work much better than other brands. And for the price on prime day you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Cee

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY WARNING!
customer_reviews.text: These wipers are very dangerous. The wiper blade got off the hook in the middle of the rain, in a highway. This happened after only 3 days of use, during the wipers' second rain. These are very, very low quality wipers.
customer_reviews.author: Javito

customer_reviews.title: Just love that wiper blade chattering noise!  NOT!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a set of these for my wife's fairly new car. After only a few weeks she complained that they were chattering and driving her crazy. Sure enough, I tried them out and they were. Very surprising for Rain-X brand as I have bought other lines of wipers from them with no problems. You might want to pass on these.
customer_reviews.author: Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: If you like that chattering wiper blade sound, these are the ones to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a set of these for my wife's fairly new car. After only a few weeks she complained that they were chattering and driving her crazy. Sure enough, I tried them out and they were. Very surprising for Rain-X brand as I have bought other lines of wipers from them with no problems. You might want to pass on these.
customer_reviews.author: Gatlin

customer_reviews.title: Wipe it real good
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding normal windshield wipers that didn’t have a bunch of negative reviews. I went with these and they NORMAL wipers that fit perfectly if you buy the right size for your vehicle. The people who wrote negative reviews for these probably need glasses. Or prune juice or something. Seriously... Normal and good wipers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoning Around

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wipers!
customer_reviews.text: Fit as required and work great! I find they hold to the windshield even at highway speeds so definitely recommend! Very simple installation!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: I was rather disappointed in these actually as within a month they started to wear out. I wasn't going for anything cheap but I was trying to replace the ones on my scion frs without breaking the bank. Good fit, easy install, but not very good at their main job. Spend the extra few dollars and get a better pair elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: GarrettB930

customer_reviews.title: Very important to have working wipers
customer_reviews.text: Be sure your wiper blades are in good shape. If not, get a solid wiper like Rain-X to replace them. Replace both at the same time - if one is going bad, the other probably isn't far behind. Be sure to check if your blades are different sizes. For example, my Ford Focus uses one 19" blade on the passenger side, and a 22" blade on the driver side.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Wiper blades are important
customer_reviews.text: Be sure your wiper blades are in good shape. If not, get a solid wiper like Rain-X to replace them. Replace both at the same time - if one is going bad, the other probably isn't far behind. Be sure to check if your blades are different sizes. For example, my Ford Focus uses one 19" blade on the passenger side, and a 22" blade on the driver side.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Don't see why you'd pay more for something else ? These were a virtual "snap" to install and work beautifully. Took longer to take out of their cases than it did to install them...Slide and listen for the click....Stop looking.....These are the wipers you've been looking for...
customer_reviews.author: NPG

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2013 Nissan Sentra
customer_reviews.text: I put in my car’s information and it said it fit my 2013 Nissan Sentra SV front driver side but it does not. The connection was wrong so that it did not touch the windshield. I bought this a while ago as a set with a 28” driver side and 15” passenger side blade. The passenger side did fit, but the driver side did not. Yet it still says that it will fit my car when I enter it in. Buy them in store.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole T Macko

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 months on both our cars
customer_reviews.text: I bought sets for both my Jeep and my husband's car. Now 4 months later both of our sets have a blade that is no longer making contact with the windshield. I am wondering if this is a lesser quality version put out by RainX, like how when you shop at an outlet store you get a product that is made more cheaply or defective. In any case, going to try another brand just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleNYGal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Weird to install, but maybe it's just me. I think I was overthinking it. I got it on just fine and it works so well! I'm happy with Amazon's set up where you can look up products based on your car type. I bought these for my moms car and everyone's happy with it. Works well! Great quality! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, been using for six months.
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install. I love the rain X windshield wipers.! I love how they repel the rain they work really well on my car. They were super easy to install and they lasted over six months.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Easy to Install. It Wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I have moved to these less expensive blades and extremely happy. This is a repurchase. They seem to last just as long as the more expensive ones, but for much less. I am very happy with them. It is always such a great feeling when you put new blades on. I do keep my car in a garage which may also help longevity.
customer_reviews.author: richman107

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Easy to Install. It Wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I have moved to these less expensive blades and extremely happy. This is a repurchase. They seem to last just as long as the more expensive ones, but for much less. I am very happy with them. It is always such a great feeling when you put new blades on. I do keep my car in a garage which may also help longevity.
customer_reviews.author: richman107

customer_reviews.title: No clean wipes here
customer_reviews.text: Does not wipe well. Smears water around more than wiping clean.
customer_reviews.author: flashotter

customer_reviews.title: Pulled the car into the rain and they work just fine, my old ones are very old and in ...
customer_reviews.text: With the Snaffoo behind me the new wiper blades showed today. Just happening to be a day full of rain with more coming. Managed to put them in myself with very simple directions to follow on the box. Pulled the car into the rain and they work just fine, my old ones are very old and in need of replacement. Wow what a difference!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Not overly impressed
customer_reviews.text: They are “hopping”already after 2 months... I live in Oregon, where it rains every day. I might have had a defective product because I have only heard good things about this product. I’m not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Momma

customer_reviews.title: works as expected. Nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: Because the 26" model is one of the only wiper blades that fit under the stock support on my 2004 Honda Accord. I've used for many many years because of this. They work just fine, but after about a year get chatty and once the blade ripped and the metal edge scored my windshield. Still has the mark today.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Wipes the rain away.
customer_reviews.text: These budget windshield wipers do exactly what I need them to do: wipe away precipitation. I had the chance to use them on my way to work and let me tell you, the rain falling on the windshield was thoroughly wiped away by this product. I opted for the cheaper version ("Weatherbeater") but they're doing a much better job than my previous wipers so I feel good about them for now. Will update this review if they stop working but for the time being they are the best windshield wipers on my car at this moment.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Better to see through a blurred window than hear that horrible sound!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible squeeking sound that does not go away. I've had these for weeks and cringe every time I have to turn on the wiper. I had ordered two, a 26" and a 22". The 22" is silent, but this one is unbearable. Also only clears the windshield in one direction (make the "sound" as it skips across my windshield in the other directions). In looking at the two blades for differences, it appears the silent one is straight and the loud wiper is somewhat wavy.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Parker

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart - Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: Husband installed easily but unfortunately after turning on the car's wipers, it fell apart. Very disappointed, as RainX wipers are usually dependable. We've used RainX for years without issue. Possibly just received a dud. Hope this won't happen again. Can NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H.

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 2015 F-150 correctly, easy to install. Windows are smear free
customer_reviews.text: After three years, I finally had to replace the original wipers on my F150 truck. I went with the Rain-X honestly because they were cheaper than others and the size I needed was in stock. As it turns out, these are pretty good wipers and were easy to install. They fit my truck correctly have worked fine for three months now. No smears or missed spots even in heavy downpours.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Received this product on time and in new condition. For the money, it’s a great value. Very easy to install and hardly took more than 1min for both. The length is exactly as the specified accordingly to the need of the vehicle. Recommend buy from the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: DrRH

customer_reviews.title: For small hook only.
customer_reviews.text: 2003 Mitsubishi Eclipse has a big hook on driver's side and small hook on passenger side so this unfortunately didn't work. They are good blades though, have one as rear wiper on a 2003 Chevy Trailblazer.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: Rain-X RX30228 Weatherbeater Wiper Blade - 28-Inches - (Pack of 1)
product_meta.description: Size:28-Inches| Style:Single packIn 2001 Rain-X introduced the Weatherbeater wiper blade, continuing its tradition of designing products that help you see more clearly and outsmart the elements, for a better driving experience. The Rain-X Weatherbeater wiper blade continues to be a favorite wiper blade of drivers looking for wipe quality, durability and a great value.
feature_bullets: The galvanized steel frame prevents rust and corrosion while providing strength and durability.
Natural rubber squeegee resists cracking, splitting and tearing caused by heat, cold, windshield wiper fluid and salt
Provides a smooth, clean, streak-free wipe due to multiple press points that conform to your windshield
The original Rain-X Weatherbeater wiper blade! For over 15 years, this traditional wiper blade is still known and trusted for its quality, durability and value.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,702 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
